exercises.name: Lunging
exercises.purpose: Helps the horse learn voice commands, develop balance, and improve fitness.
exercises.description: In a controlled circle, the horse moves at different gaits (walk, trot, canter) while the trainer guides from the center. Variations include changing directions, speeds, and distances.

exercises.name: Groundwork Exercises
exercises.purpose: Builds respect and establishes trust between horse and handler.
exercises.description: Exercises can include yielding the hindquarters, backing up, and sending exercises. Groundwork prepares the horse for riding or other in-hand work.

exercises.name: Pole Work
exercises.description: Trotting or walking over ground poles, either in a straight line or in varied patterns. Can be elevated for additional difficulty and muscle-building.

exercises.name: Lateral Work
exercises.description: Includes exercises like leg yields, shoulder-ins, and haunches-ins, encouraging the horse to move laterally or 'sideways' to improve suppleness.

exercises.name: Transitions Between Gaits
exercises.description: Moving from one gait to another (e.g., walk to trot, trot to canter), then back down. Builds smoothness and responsiveness.

exercises.name: Circles and Serpentines
exercises.purpose: Improves balance, flexibility, and engagement of the hindquarters.
exercises.description: Riding circles of varying sizes (10m, 20m) and serpentines encourages the horse to bend, which is critical for balance.

exercises.name: Backing Up
exercises.purpose: Develops muscle in the hindquarters and encourages obedience.
exercises.description: The horse takes a few steps backward on cue, strengthening hind muscles and improving response to cues.

exercises.name: Desensitization Exercises
exercises.purpose: Builds the horseâ€™s confidence and trust.
exercises.description: Introduces the horse to various stimuli (tarps, flags, water, etc.) to reduce spooking and increase calmness.

exercises.name: Yielding to Pressure
exercises.purpose: Reinforces respect and teaches softness to pressure.
exercises.description: The horse learns to move away from pressure on different parts of its body (shoulders, hindquarters, face), preparing it for refined movements.

exercises.name: Halter and Lead Training
exercises.purpose: Teaches good ground manners and responsiveness.
exercises.description: The horse is taught to walk, stop, turn, and back up on a lead line, emphasizing control, obedience, and respect.

exercises.name: Liberty Work
exercises.purpose: Enhances trust and connection between horse and handler.
exercises.description: Working with the horse without ropes or tack, relying solely on body language and trust. This deepens the bond and promotes responsiveness and understanding.

exercises.name: Trail Work
exercises.purpose: Builds confidence, navigational skills, and stamina in different environments.
exercises.description: Introducing the horse to trails, navigating natural obstacles, and adjusting to varied terrains to increase adaptability and confidence.
